knowledge_chunks.summary: Picking flowers provides an instant sanity boost of +5 per flower. They are a crucial and renewable early-game resource for sanity management, as they can be replanted by butterflies, or respawn from bees and rainfall.

data.usage_scene: Gaining a quick, small amount of sanity at any game stage.
data.notes: Flowers are renewable. They can respawn via bees, rainfall, or by planting caught butterflies.

knowledge_chunks.summary: The Garland is an easily craftable head item that provides a passive sanity regeneration aura. It requires 12 Petals and can be made without a Science Machine, making it highly accessible in the early game.

The Top Hat provides a superior sanity regeneration aura compared to the Garland. It requires a Science Machine and 6 Silk to craft and is also a necessary component for unlocking the Magic crafting tab.

data.notes: Crafting a Top Hat is required to unlock the Magic tab for the first time.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Watermelon and Jerky are effective food items for restoring sanity. Raw Watermelon gives +5 sanity, while Grilled Watermelon gives +7.5. Small Jerky and regular Jerky restore +10 and +15 sanity respectively, and are excellent long-lasting food sources, making them ideal for winter.

items.notes: Made from Morsels, Drumsticks, Fish, or Bat Wings on a Drying Rack.
Made from Meat on a Drying Rack.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Sanity Food - Cooked Green Mushrooms & Cactus Flesh
knowledge_chunks.summary: Cooked Green Mushrooms and Cooked Cactus Flesh are two of the best sanity-restoring foods. Both provide +15 sanity when cooked. Green Mushrooms must be picked at dusk, and eating them raw causes a massive sanity loss of -50. Cactus Flesh deals damage when picked without armor, but is available year-round.

items.notes: Raw Green Mushrooms drain 50 sanity. They are found in Deciduous Forests and Marshes and can only be picked at dusk.
Cactus is available year-round in the desert. Wear armor when harvesting to avoid taking damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Sanity Crock Pot Dishes - Popsicles and Ice Cream
knowledge_chunks.summary: Certain crock pot dishes are excellent for sanity. Melonsicles restore +20 sanity, while Banana Pops restore +33 sanity and +20 health, but require Bananas from the caves. The best is Ice Cream, which restores a massive +50 sanity but requires Electric Milk from Volt Goats.

items.notes: Efficient as it relies on farmable watermelon.
The highest sanity-restoring food. Requires Electric Milk (from Volt Goats), making it a later-game option.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Sanity Gain from Killing Shadow Creatures
knowledge_chunks.summary: Killing the shadow creatures that spawn when your sanity is low will instantly restore a portion of your sanity. This creates a feedback loop where fighting your insanity directly rewards you with sanity. This is a primary method for players who intentionally lower their sanity to farm Nightmare Fuel.
Prototyping a new item for the first time at any crafting station provides an instant +15 sanity boost. This is a natural way to regain sanity while progressing through the game's tech tree.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Sanity Auras - Glommer and Tam o' Shanter
knowledge_chunks.summary: Passive sanity regeneration can be achieved through auras from followers and gear. Glommer provides a +6.25 sanity/min aura to nearby players. The Tam o' Shanter, a drop from MacTusk, is one of the best head items, providing +6.7 sanity/min, excellent insulation, and is repairable.

auras.condition: Player must be very close to Glommer.

auras.notes: Drops from MacTusk with a 25% chance. Also provides 120 insulation and can be repaired with a Sewing Kit.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Befriended followers provide a powerful sanity regeneration aura, which can stack up to +25/min depending on the number of followers. This applies to Pigmen and Bunnymen. Additionally, the pet Hutch, when transformed into Music Box Hutch, provides an incredible +40 sanity/min aura.

auras.condition: Depends on number of followers and proximity.
Player must stand directly on top of it. Requires finding Hutch in the caves and feeding it a One-man Band and a light source.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Sleeping in a Tent, Bed Roll, or Siesta Lean-to restores sanity and health over time, but at the cost of hunger. A Tent restores +1 sanity per second, while a Siesta Lean-to does the same but without draining hunger.

actions.cost: No hunger cost, but requires summer to be effective.

knowledge_chunks.summary: The Lunar Island introduces the Enlightenment mechanic, which is the inverse of Sanity. Being in the Lunar Biome converts your missing sanity into Enlightenment. Standing near Lunar Fissures or getting hit by Gestalts will rapidly increase your Enlightenment, which in turn restores your Sanity to full when you leave the biome's influence.

data.relationship: Inverse to Sanity. 100% Enlightenment equals 0% Sanity. 0% Enlightenment equals 100% Sanity.

sanity_gain_methods.effect: Restores Sanity by converting it from Enlightenment at up to +100/min, depending on Moon Phase.
Instantly restores +10 Sanity by converting it from Enlightenment.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Late Game Sanity - Bee Queen Crown
knowledge_chunks.summary: The Bee Queen Crown is the ultimate sanity management item. Dropped by the Bee Queen, this powerful headwear completely inverts all negative sanity auras into positive ones. This allows you to stand next to monsters like Deerclops or near Nightmare Lights and rapidly gain sanity instead of losing it.

data.special_effect: Inverts all negative sanity auras into positive sanity gain.
data.usage_scene: Completely nullifying sanity drain from bosses, monsters, night, dusk, wetness, Nightmare Lights, and Evil Flowers.
data.notes: Also provides 70% damage reduction and is waterproof.

video_info.title: How to ESSENTIALLY Survive Your First Year of Don't Starve Together

knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk details the recommended world creation settings for a beginner player. It suggests the 'Survival' playstyle, enabling Caves for more content, and provides specific settings for solo players. It also recommends the 'Geometric Placement' and 'Craft Pot' client mods for a better experience.

recommended_mods.name: Geometric Placement
recommended_mods.purpose: Snaps objects to a grid for neat building.

recommended_mods.name: Craft Pot
recommended_mods.purpose: Helps experiment and learn Crock Pot recipes.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This section provides character recommendations for new players. It highlights Wendy and Willow as strong choices due to their companion abilities (Abigail and Bernie, respectively) that act as bodyguards. The guide creator chooses to play as Wilson to ensure the strategies shown are generic and applicable to any character.

recommended_for_beginners.name: Wendy
recommended_for_beginners.reason: Effectively has a bodyguard (her twin sister Abigail) to help with safety and combat.

recommended_for_beginners.name: Willow
recommended_for_beginners.reason: Effectively has a bodyguard (her teddy bear, Bernie) to help with safety.

guide_character_choice.name: Wilson
guide_character_choice.reason: He has few specific upsides or downsides, and his skill tree is not used in the guide, making the strategies universally applicable.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Core Survival Mechanics: Health, Hunger, and Sanity
knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk explains the three core survival meters: Health, Hunger, and Sanity. It details how each meter depletes and the consequences of them reaching zero, such as death from zero health or starvation, and attacks from Shadow Creatures at low sanity.

survival_meters.name: Health
survival_meters.description: If it hits zero, you die. It is lost from taking damage from mobs or the environment, and from starvation.

survival_meters.name: Hunger
survival_meters.description: Drains by 75 points per day. When it hits zero, you begin starving, which drains health at a rate of 1.25 points per second.

survival_meters.name: Sanity
survival_meters.description: Doesn't directly kill you. As it lowers, the screen becomes desaturated. Below 50% of maximum, Shadow Creatures appear. Below 15% of maximum, they become hostile and will attack, draining health and sanity.

knowledge_chunks.summary: The guide outlines the tasks for the first day, which starts in Autumn. Players should stay in the relatively safe starter biome, gather essential resources like twigs, grass, and flint, and collect readily available food such as carrots and berries. The goal is to accumulate basic materials without engaging in combat.

day_1_goals.details: Identified by bright green grass turf and general lack of danger.
Collect approximately 40 Twigs from Saplings, 40 Grass from Grass Tufts, and at least 3 Flint from the ground.
Pick Berries and Carrots. You need the equivalent of 6 carrots per day to manage hunger.
Pick up seeds dropped by birds.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This section explains that some worlds generate with alternate versions of basic resources. It describes Twiggy Trees, Grass Gekkos, and Juicy Berry Bushes as substitutes for Saplings, Grass Tufts, and Berry Bushes, detailing their unique properties and where to find them.

alternate_resources.name: Twiggy Trees
alternate_resources.details: Twigs can be picked from the ground near them or the trees can be chopped down. They regrow twigs over time.

alternate_resources.name: Grass Gekkos
alternate_resources.details: Found in Rocky biomes. Scare them to make them drop their tail, which counts as grass. The tail regrows in 2 days.

alternate_resources.name: Juicy Berry Bushes
alternate_resources.details: Grow 3 juicy berries at once but take longer to regrow. Juicy berries also spoil much faster than regular ones.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This part covers crucial steps for surviving the first night. It explains how to get emergency healing from Butterfly Wings, the dangers of dusk (sanity drain) and night (Charlie attacks in darkness), and how to craft an Axe and Torch to provide light and safety.

healing_source.source: Kill butterflies that spawn from flowers.

dangers: Sanity drains at 5 points per minute during dusk.
Complete darkness summons 'Charlie' (the Grue), who attacks for massive damage and sanity loss.
solutions: Craft a Torch to provide a portable light source.
Light a tree on fire for a large, temporary light source.
Craft a Campfire for a stationary, more permanent light source.

essential_first_crafts.purpose: Chop trees for logs and serves as a basic weapon.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Day 2 (Autumn): Finding Gold in the Mosaic Biome
knowledge_chunks.summary: The guide instructs the player to locate the Mosaic biome to mine Gold, a critical resource. It describes how to identify this biome by its mix of turfs and warns about the hostile Tallbirds found there. The goal is to mine Boulders with gold veins to collect gold nuggets and rocks using a Pickaxe.

structured_data.biome_identification: A mix of various turfs: grassy, forest, rocky, swamp, cobblestone, and barren. It is always connected to the starter biome.
structured_data.resource_source: Mine Boulders with gold veins using a Pickaxe.

local_danger.behavior: Aggressive mob that patrols near its nest and attacks players who get too close. Can be avoided by running away until it loses interest.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Day 3 (Autumn): Science Machine and Essential Gear Crafting
knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk focuses on technological progression by crafting a Science Machine. It explains how to unlock new recipes and the concept of pre-crafting structures. Key items to prototype and craft are the Backpack for more inventory space, the Spear for better combat, and the Log Suit for damage reduction.

key_structure.name: Science Machine
key_structure.purpose: Unlocks Tier 1 recipes. Prototyping an item (crafting it for the first time) unlocks it permanently, allowing it to be crafted anywhere. Restores 15 sanity upon first-time crafts.

structured_data.pro_tip: Structures can be pre-crafted to carry the materials in a single inventory slot before placing them down.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This section guides the player to a Forest biome to farm Pigs. The goal is to acquire Meat and Pig Skins, which are essential for creating better items. The strategy involves hammering Pig Houses to get materials and then fighting the homeless pigs one-on-one.

farming_strategy.method: Use a Hammer to destroy Pig Houses. This yields half the crafting materials back, including Pig Skin. Then, kill the now homeless pig.
farming_strategy.combat_tactic: Wear a Log Suit. Lure pigs one at a time. Dodge their attack, then hit them 3-4 times. Repeat.

structured_data.mob_interactions: Pigs are neutral but will become hostile if one is attacked near them. They attack spiders on sight.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This bonus tip explains how to use Touch Stones for resurrection. After dying, the player becomes a ghost and can float to a Touch Stone and haunt it to revive. Each Touch Stone can only be used once per player.

resurrection_method.location: Found randomly in the world, often surrounded by Pig Heads on spikes.
resurrection_method.process: After dying, navigate your ghost to an unused Touch Stone and haunt it to resurrect.
resurrection_method.limitation: Each Touch Stone works only once per player.
resurrection_method.post_revival: You must return to your skeleton to pick up your dropped items.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A safe, non-combat method for farming spiders is shown. By crafting and placing Traps near a Spider Nest, players can lure spiders into them for an instant kill, easily gathering Silk, Monster Meat, and Spider Glands.

structured_data.method: Craft Traps (from the 'Tools' tab). Place them on the ground. Lure a spider by walking near it, then lead it over the trap. The spider is caught and killed instantly.

knowledge_chunks.summary: By Day 9, the player should establish a base. This involves building a Fire Pit, Chests, an Alchemy Engine, and Crock Pots. The guide also covers finding Glommer's Statue to acquire Glommer on a full moon for a significant sanity boost.

essential_base_structures.name: Fire Pit
essential_base_structures.purpose: A permanent, efficient light and heat source.

essential_base_structures.name: Alchemy Engine
essential_base_structures.purpose: Unlocks Tier 2 recipes, replacing the Science Machine.

essential_base_structures.name: Crock Pot
essential_base_structures.purpose: Cooks advanced food dishes with superior stats.

special_npc_acquisition.name: Glommer
special_npc_acquisition.location: Spawns at Glommer's Statue during a full moon.
special_npc_acquisition.benefit: Provides a +6.25/min sanity aura and drops Glommer's Goop.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This section details crucial preparations for the upcoming winter season. The main goals are to craft a Football Helmet for better protection, a Ham Bat as a powerful weapon that uses hunger instead of durability, and a Thermal Stone to manage body temperature.

winter_preparation_crafts.purpose: Provides 80% damage reduction and occupies the head slot, allowing it to be worn with a Log Suit.
A powerful weapon that spoils over time instead of losing durability, making it excellent for extended fights. Deals 59.5 damage when fresh.
When heated by a fire, it stores warmth and slows down freezing in winter.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Autumn (Day 12): Food Security and Base Expansion
knowledge_chunks.summary: The guide focuses on establishing long-term food security by creating Drying Racks and Bee Boxes. Drying Racks turn meat into jerky, a long-lasting and restorative food. Bee Boxes produce honey, a crucial ingredient for powerful healing items.

food_structures.name: Drying Rack
food_structures.purpose: Dries meat to create Jerky or Small Jerky, which restores Health, Hunger, and Sanity and lasts much longer.

food_structures.name: Bee Box
food_structures.purpose: Generates Honey over time. Requires catching bees with a Bug Net and destroying a beehive for the honeycomb.

food_items.name: Honey
food_items.use: Excellent Crock Pot ingredient, especially for healing foods like Honey Poultice.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk details the final steps to prepare for winter. It involves crafting a Bird Cage to produce eggs and a Winter Hat for insulation. It also recommends stocking up on logs and grass before winter arrives.

final_winter_prep.purpose: Cage a bird (caught with a Bird Trap) and feed it meat to get eggs, a valuable Crock Pot ingredient.
Provides 120 seconds of insulation against the cold.

final_winter_prep.details: Gather a large amount of logs and grass before winter, as they will be scarce.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Winter (Day 21): Surviving the Cold and Deerclops
knowledge_chunks.summary: This part explains how to survive the first days of winter. Key activities include managing body temperature with a Thermal Stone and Winter Hat, and preparing for the first boss, Deerclops, who arrives around Day 30. The guide also covers creating an Ice Box for food preservation.

key_mechanics: Freezing: Player temperature will drop, requiring warm clothing (Winter Hat) and a heat source (Fire Pit, heated Thermal Stone) to prevent health loss.

boss_prep.name: Deerclops
boss_prep.preparation: Build a panic room/arena away from your main base with a Fire Pit. Craft multiple Log Suits and Football Helmets.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Winter (Day 24): Obtaining Gears and Finding Walrus Camps
knowledge_chunks.summary: The guide shows how to obtain Gears, a crucial crafting component. The primary methods are digging up graves (which costs sanity) or finding and fighting Clockwork monsters in the Mosaic biome. It also introduces the Walrus Camp, a winter-exclusive location for obtaining valuable loot.

methods.name: Digging Graves
methods.risk: Costs sanity and can spawn ghosts.

methods.name: Fighting Clockworks
methods.details: Clockwork Knights, Bishops, and Rooks drop gears upon defeat.

winter_location.name: Walrus Camp (Igoo)
winter_location.inhabitants: MacTusk, Wee MacTusk, and two Blue Hounds.
winter_location.loot: Can drop Walrus Tusk (for Walking Cane) and Tam o' Shanter (excellent sanity-restoring hat).

knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk provides a strategy for fighting and defeating the winter boss, Deerclops. The recommended method is tanking, which involves equipping armor (Log Suit, Football Helmet) and repeatedly hitting the boss with a Ham Bat while standing near a fire to stay warm. The goal is to obtain the Deerclops Eyeball.

structured_data.tactic: Lure Deerclops to a pre-built arena away from your base. Stand near the fire pit and continuously attack with the Ham Bat, swapping out armor as it breaks. Heal when necessary.
structured_data.drop_use: Craft the Eyebrella, the best item for Spring's rain.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Spring (Day 36): Dealing with Rain and Preparing for Moose/Goose
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section covers the start of Spring and its main challenge: constant rain, which causes wetness. The guide advises crafting an Eyebrella for 100% water protection. It also introduces the Spring boss, Moose/Goose, and suggests finding its nests to prepare for the encounter.

key_mechanic.name: Rain/Wetness
key_mechanic.effect: Causes sanity drain, tool slippage, and eventually freezing and health loss if wetness is high.

boss_prep.name: Moose/Goose
boss_prep.location: Spawns at several setpiece nests around the map during Spring.

knowledge_chunks.summary: The focus shifts to advanced farming. The guide recommends building Farm Plots and using a Gardeneer Hat to research plants. It also explains the benefits of a Bird Cage for turning monster meat into eggs and introduces key Crock Pot recipes like Pierogi for healing.

farming_setup.name: Farm Plot
farming_setup.purpose: Used to grow crops from seeds.

farming_setup.name: Gardeneer Hat
farming_setup.purpose: Allows identification of plants to learn their specific needs.

utility.name: Bird Cage
utility.use: Feed a caged bird any meat (including monster meat) to receive fresh eggs.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk presents a strategy to defeat the Moose/Goose boss. The method involves luring the boss away from its nest, killing it, and then dealing with its lightning-summoning offspring, the Moslings. The main reward is the Down Feather, used to craft a Weather Pain.

structured_data.tactic: Lure the Moose/Goose away from its nest and Moslings. Dodge its charge attack, then land 2-3 hits. Repeat. After it dies, the Moslings will become enraged, spinning and calling down lightning. Hit them between their spin attacks.
structured_data.drop_use: Used to craft the Weather Pain, a powerful ranged weapon.

knowledge_chunks.summary: The guide outlines preparations for Summer, the most dangerous season due to overheating. Key items to craft are an Endothermic Firepit for cooling, a Floral Shirt for passive cooling, and to gather Nitre for Endothermic Fires. It also advises finding the Oasis desert.

preparation_tasks.purpose: A permanent structure that provides cooling.
Provides passive cooling and a small sanity boost.

preparation_tasks.source: Mining boulders in the Rocky biome.

preparation_tasks.purpose: The Oasis is a key location for surviving summer.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk details how to survive Summer. The main strategies are staying near an Endothermic Fire or in the Oasis to prevent overheating. It also warns about wildfires, which can spontaneously ignite and destroy your base, and introduces the summer boss, Antlion, who resides in the Oasis.

dangers.name: Overheating
dangers.solutions: Stay near an Endothermic Fire/Firepit, wear a Floral Shirt, or stay in the Oasis biome.

dangers.name: Wildfires
dangers.effect: Objects can spontaneously combust, potentially destroying your base.

summer_boss.name: Antlion
summer_boss.behavior: Causes sinkholes and cave-ins unless appeased with trinkets or rocks.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A guide to defeating the Antlion boss in the Oasis desert. The strategy involves building walls to trap Antlion, dodging its sand spike attacks, and hitting it in between. Defeating Antlion rewards The Deconstruction Staff and prevents world-damaging cave-ins.

structured_data.tactic: Build a set of stone walls around Antlion to trap it. When it summons sand spikes, run to avoid them. After the attack, run in and hit Antlion a few times. Repeat until defeated.
structured_data.benefits_of_defeating: Stops Antlion from causing sinkholes and cave-ins for the rest of summer.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Summer (Day 68): Final Preparations and First Year Survival
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section marks the end of the first year. With all seasonal bosses defeated, the player is now well-equipped to survive indefinitely. The guide suggests preparing for the second year by crafting more advanced items like a Meat Effigy for self-resurrection and setting up a more robust farm.

next_steps.purpose: A resurrection item that can be placed at your base. Costs max health to build.

next_steps.details: Create a larger, more efficient farm for a stable food supply.
With the surface world managed, the caves offer new challenges and resources.

knowledge_chunks.topic: How to Easily Kill Shadow Creatures
knowledge_chunks.summary: This bonus tip provides a simple combat strategy for defeating Shadow Creatures, which appear at low sanity. The tactic is to dodge their initial attack, then counter-attack them until they are defeated, as they cannot attack again immediately.

structured_data.combat_strategy: When a Shadow Creature appears and becomes hostile, wait for it to start its attack animation. Dodge the attack by moving out of the way. Immediately run back in and attack it repeatedly. It will be stun-locked and unable to fight back before it dies.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A collection of final essential tips for survival. This includes managing sanity with items like Cooked Green Caps and the Tam o' Shanter, using a Sewing Kit to repair clothing, and building a Lightning Rod to protect the base from lightning strikes in Spring and Summer.

tips.details: Cooked Green Caps restore 15 sanity but cost 1 health. A Tam o' Shanter hat provides a large passive sanity boost.
A Sewing Kit can be used to repair clothing items like hats and shirts, restoring their durability.
A Lightning Rod protects structures within its radius from being struck by lightning during rainstorms.

video_info.title: Don't Starve Guide for Absolute Beginners (The First 20 Days)

knowledge_chunks.summary: This section explains how to resurrect your character after dying. By finding a Touch Stone on the map and haunting it as a ghost, you can be brought back to life. This action can only be performed once per Touch Stone per player.

process: Upon death, you become a ghost.
Locate a Touch Stone structure on the map.
As a ghost, float over to the Touch Stone and haunt it.
You will be resurrected at the Touch Stone's location.
Return to where you died to pick up your dropped items.
important_notes: Each Touch Stone can only be used once per player.
It's wise to store edible items in a backpack, as pigs and spiders may eat food left on the ground after you die.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A safe strategy for gathering silk by using traps to catch spiders one by one without engaging in direct combat. This method allows you to clear out a spider nest and destroy it for additional silk, including dealing with tougher Spider Warriors from higher-tier nests.

strategy: Craft a Trap and place it near a Spider Nest.
Lure a spider out by getting close or stepping on the surrounding web.
Lead the spider into the trap.
Pick up the trapped spider and kill it from your inventory to avoid aggroing other spiders.
Repeat until the nest is empty.
Destroy the empty nest for a bonus silk drop.
data.notes: Higher level (Tier 2 or 3) nests may spawn Spider Warriors, which can also be lured into traps.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Explains how to craft and use the Alchemy Engine, the tier 2 science structure. It's recommended to prototype the necessary Electrical Doodads and then pre-craft the Alchemy Engine without placing it to save inventory space.

data.tip: Pre-craft the Alchemy Engine near a Science Machine but don't place it right away to keep your inventory free.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Crafting a Top Hat for Sanity
knowledge_chunks.summary: Details the crafting of a Top Hat, an essential early-game item for sanity management. Wearing the Top Hat provides a slow, passive sanity regeneration, which helps counteract the sanity drain from various in-game events.

data.usage_note: A primary tool for sanity management in the early game. The alternative is to let sanity drop and fight Nightmare Creatures for Nightmare Fuel.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Crafting a Bug Net and Catching Fireflies
knowledge_chunks.summary: Shows how to craft a Bug Net and use it to catch Fireflies at night. Fireflies are a key component for creating mobile and hands-free light sources.

data.usage: Catching bugs, specifically Fireflies at night for this guide's purpose.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Getting Light Bulbs and Crafting a Lantern
knowledge_chunks.summary: This segment guides the player to enter the Caves via a Plugged Sinkhole to gather Light Bulbs. These are then used with an Alchemy Engine to craft a Lantern, a superior, placeable, and refuelable light source.

pros: Can be placed on the ground, freeing up the hand slot.
Refuelable with Light Bulbs or Slurtle Slime.
data.related_action: Find a Plugged Sinkhole, mine it with a pickaxe, and enter the Caves to pick Light Bulbs from Light Plants.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Introduces the Ham Bat, a powerful weapon with infinite durability that can be crafted at the Alchemy Engine. Its main drawback is that it spoils over time, causing its damage to decrease as it rots.

cons: Spoils over time, and its damage decreases as it rots.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Crafting the Football Helmet and Using the Scrapbook
knowledge_chunks.summary: Explains how to craft the Football Helmet, a crucial piece of armor providing 80% damage reduction. It also introduces the Scrapbook, an in-game feature for looking up stats of encountered items and mobs.

data.usage_note: Essential for combat. Should be equipped when in danger.

related_feature.name: Scrapbook
related_feature.description: Found in the pause menu, it provides detailed stats for items and mobs you've encountered.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Clarifies that wearing both a Log Suit and a Football Helmet does not stack their damage reduction percentages. The 80% reduction cap applies, but the damage taken is split between both items, making them last longer.

data.effect: Damage reduction is capped at the highest value of equipped armor (80%). The durability loss is split between the pieces.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A guide to crafting the Miner Hat, a hands-free light source. It's more convenient than a Lantern for exploration and combat at night as it equips to the head slot, leaving hands free for weapons or tools.

data.pros: Provides light while keeping the hand slot free, making it ideal for working or fighting at night.

knowledge_chunks.summary: With a Ham Bat and armor, players can confidently fight spiders directly. A standard spider can be killed in just two hits, making combat a more viable option for gathering silk and other resources.

data.strategy: With a Ham Bat, a normal spider can be killed in two hits, allowing for aggressive farming.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Explains the process of creating Charcoal by burning trees. A torch can be used to set a tree on fire, which can spread to nearby trees. Chopping down the resulting burnt trees yields charcoal.

process: Use a Torch to set a tree on fire.
Allow the fire to spread to a manageable number of trees.
Once the trees are burnt, chop them down with an Axe to collect Charcoal.
data.warning: Fire spreads easily. To stop an uncontrolled fire, run away to unload the chunk, which pauses the fire's spread.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This segment covers two methods for catching Rabbits. The primary method is to place a trap between a rabbit and its hole. Alternatively, at dusk or night, a shovel can be used to dig them out of their holes.

data.behavior: When approached, it flees towards its hole.

catching_methods.description: Place a Trap directly on or between the rabbit and its hole, then approach to scare it into the trap.
During dusk or night, use a Shovel on a rabbit hole to force the rabbit out.

knowledge_chunks.summary: The Prestihatitator, the tier 1 magic crafting station, is introduced. It is crafted at a Science Machine and requires a Top Hat and four rabbits, unlocking a new branch of magic-based recipes.

data.function: Unlocks Tier 1 magic recipes, the equivalent of a Science Machine for magic.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Provides combat strategies for defeating the three main Clockwork creatures: the Bishop, Knight, and Rook. Defeating them is the primary way to obtain Gears, a crucial crafting component.

data.strategy: Has a ranged attack. The best strategy is to rush it down and attack continuously with a Ham Bat and armor, as its ranged attack is difficult to dodge consistently.
Kite this enemy. Attack 2-3 times, then dodge its swing. Repeat this pattern.
Alternates between charging towards and away from the player. Get very close and attack to try and stunlock it. Its charge attack is highly destructive to structures and trees.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Discusses ideal locations for building a base, recommending a central spot on the map near key resources like wormholes and a sinkhole. It also touches on base layout and using a tethered Beefalo for defense.

criteria: Central location on the map for easy access to all areas.
Near a Wormhole for rapid travel.
Relatively close to a Sinkhole for cave access.
Near a neutral mob herd (like Beefalo) for protection against hounds.
data.layout_tip: A 7x7 tile square with inverted corners is a good starting size. A Pitchfork can be used to see the world grid.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Crafting the Ice Box and Crock Pots
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section covers crafting essential base structures for food management. The Ice Box slows food spoilage, and Crock Pots allow for combining ingredients into more potent food dishes.

items.function: Reduces food spoilage rate by half.
Combines four food ingredients to create advanced recipes with superior stats.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Crock Pot Recipes: Meatballs and Meaty Stew
knowledge_chunks.summary: Provides two essential Crock Pot recipes for hunger: Meatballs and Meaty Stew. It explains the ingredients and warns against using more than one Monster Meat to avoid making Monster Lasagna.

recipes.ingredients: 1 Meat (any type) + 3 Fillers (e.g., berries, carrots, ice). No twigs.
Requires a total meat value of 3.0 (e.g., 1 Meat, 1 Monster Meat, 2 Morsels) + 1 Filler. No twigs.
recipes.purpose: The best dish for restoring a large amount of hunger.

data.warning: Using more than one Monster Meat in a Crock Pot recipe will result in Monster Lasagna, which is poisonous and damages health and sanity.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Explains how to find Glommer on a full moon and the benefits it provides, such as producing Glommer's Goop for fuel. It also details how pigs turn into Werepigs during a full moon, which can be farmed for meat, pig skin, and manure.

data.spawns_on: Full Moon, at Glommer's Statue in the Deciduous Forest (Pig King biome).
data.benefit: Produces Glommer's Goop, a highly efficient fuel source.

related_mob.name: Werepig
related_mob.origin: Pigmen transform during a full moon.
related_mob.farming_strategy: Feed them non-meat edible items to make them poop, then kill them for 2 Meat and 1 Pig Skin.
related_mob.purpose: A good source of Manure, Meat, and Pig Skin.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Briefly explains the function of the Pig King, who can be found in the Deciduous Forest. He trades Gold Nuggets for meat items and various trinkets.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Farming Basics with the Garden Digamajig
knowledge_chunks.summary: Introduces the basics of the farming system. It covers crafting a Garden Digamajig to create farm plots, a Garden Hoe to till the soil, and how to plant seeds. It also explains how to make crops happy to get more seeds back.

key_items.function: Tills the soil within a farm plot to create spots for planting seeds.

process: Craft and place Garden Digamajigs to create a farm area (e.g., a 2x2 plot).
Use a Garden Hoe to till spots inside the plot.
Plant seeds in the tilled spots.
Tend to the plants to keep them happy.
making_plants_happy: Talk to them at each growth stage.
Water them with a Watering Can at each stage.
Clear away any weeds or debris near them.
data.seed_return: Happy plants have a higher chance of returning 1 or 2 seeds of their specific crop type.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A quick tip on crafting additional chests to organize resources and declutter the player's inventory and base area. It notes that while items can be dropped on the ground, they risk being stolen by certain mobs.

data.tip: Craft multiple chests to organize different categories of items.
data.warning: Leaving items on the ground is risky as Moles, Catcoons, and other mobs can steal or eat them.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Covers how to craft a Fire Pit, a permanent and safer version of a basic Campfire. It provides light and a cooking source but cannot spread fire, making it ideal for a base.

pros: Permanent structure that doesn't disappear when extinguished.
Cannot spread fire to nearby objects.
data.placement_tip: Place it one tile below the center tile of the base to illuminate most of the area.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This section explains how to find, shave, and tame a Beefalo. A tethered Beefalo can be brought to the base to serve as a powerful defender against hostile mobs like Hounds.

actions.effect: The Beefalo will follow the bell, allowing you to lead it to your base.

actions.strategy: Lure one away from the herd. Attack once, dodge, then perform a 6-hit combo before dodging again. Repeat.

data.utility: A tethered Beefalo near the base acts as a strong defender against threats.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Explains the mechanics of Hound attacks, which occur periodically. The guide recommends leading the Hounds to other mobs, like Beefalo, to have them fight for you. Alternatively, players can fight them directly using a kiting pattern.

data.warning_sign: Distant barking sounds, followed by the character's warning.
strategies: Lure Hounds to a powerful neutral mob like a Beefalo herd or Treeguard.
Fight them directly by kiting: wait for the lunge, dodge, attack twice, then repeat.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Researching Plants with the Gardener Hat
knowledge_chunks.summary: Details how to research unknown plants using the Gardener Hat. By equipping the hat and inspecting plants at their various growth stages, players can identify them, learn what they produce, and distinguish them from weeds.

data.function: Allows the player to research unknown plants.
data.process: Equip the Gardener Hat and inspect a plant at each of its growth stages (sprout, small, medium, grown).
data.outcome: Once fully researched, the plant's name and properties will be revealed in the farming interface, allowing for better farm management.
data.weeds: The last four plants in the register are weeds and should be dug up to improve the happiness of nearby crops.

video_info.title: The ESSENTIAL Don't Starve Together Guide

knowledge_chunks.topic: Day 15: Acquiring a Bird Cage and Unlocking Pierogi
knowledge_chunks.summary: This segment explains how to craft essential gardening tools like the Bucket-o-poop and Gardeneer Hat to research and identify plants. It then details crafting a Bird Cage, which is crucial for turning meat (even monster meat) into Eggs. This process unlocks the powerful Pierogi healing recipe in the Crock Pot.

steps.description: Craft a Bucket-o-poop and a Gardeneer Hat to begin plant research. This allows you to identify plants, their growth stages, and any weeds in your farm plot.

crafting_info.notes: Bone Shards are obtained by hammering bones or skeletons found in desert biomes.

steps.description: Gather at least 10 Reeds from a Swamp biome. These are needed to craft Papyrus.
Craft a Bird Trap to catch a live bird.
Craft and place a Bird Cage. Once a bird is caught in the trap, place it inside the cage.
Feed the caged bird any meat (including Monster Meat) to receive an Egg. This is an efficient way to convert spoiling meat into a fresh, valuable ingredient.
Use the Egg to cook Pierogi in a Crock Pot. This is a top-tier healing food.

To create a sustainable farm of specific crops like Potatoes and Toma Roots, feed these vegetables to the caged bird. The bird will produce 1-2 seeds of that specific crop, allowing you to build up a seed supply.
steps.interaction: Give Farm Crop to Caged Bird

knowledge_chunks.summary: This chapter focuses on the essential preparations for the Winter season. It explains the freezing mechanic and details how to craft a Beefalo Hat and a Thermal Stone to maintain body temperature and survive the cold.

season_info.primary_threat: Freezing (Health loss from low body temperature)

preparation_items.purpose: Provides constant insulation while worn, slowing the rate of freezing.
Absorbs heat from fire sources and radiates it to keep the player warm. Its effectiveness decreases as it cools. Needs to be periodically reheated.

season_info.survival_strategy: Warm up next to a Campfire or burning tree until you are about to overheat. Equip the Beefalo Hat and carry a fully heated Thermal Stone to maximize the time you can spend away from a heat source.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Day 21: Acquire a Walking Cane by Hunting MacTusk
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section introduces the Winter-exclusive mob, MacTusk, and its hunting party. It provides strategies for locating and killing MacTusk to obtain the Walrus Tusk and Tam o' Shanter, which are used to craft the essential Walking Cane for a speed boost and a powerful sanity-restoring hat.

mob_info.location: Spawns from an igloo in the Moonstone Forest biome (guaranteed) or the Triple MacTusk biome (not guaranteed).
mob_info.hunting_strategy: Equip armor and weapon. Charge directly at the main MacTusk to make it flee, ignoring its two Ice Hound companions. Chase the MacTusk until it gives up and starts walking back to its igloo, then attack it. After killing the main MacTusk, deal with the Ice Hounds one by one, waiting a few seconds between kills to avoid being frozen by their icy death explosion.

loot.usage: Excellent head armor providing winter insulation and a powerful sanity regeneration aura (6.7/min).

related_item.effect: Provides a 25% movement speed bonus when equipped, making it one of the most essential items in the game.

video_info.title: The Only Don't Starve Together Guide You'll Ever Need

knowledge_chunks.summary: This section explains how to get resources from Pig Heads found in the world. They are a source of Pig Skin and Twigs.

data.location: Found on wooden platforms or pikes in the world.
data.notes: A useful source for Pig Skin if needed.

knowledge_chunks.summary: During Winter, Penguins will appear near water and build nests containing Ice Glaciers. Mining these glaciers provides Ice, a valuable Crock Pot filler that doesn't spoil in a fridge and is needed for a Summer recipe.

data.mob_behavior: Penguins will not attack when you mine their glaciers.

usage.description: Ice works as a good filler for many recipes. It never spoils if kept in a fridge.
At least 15 Ice should be saved for a crafting recipe in Summer.

data.recommended_quantity: Around 40 for Crock Pot recipes, plus 15 saved for Summer.

ingredients: Vegetable x1 (e.g., Carrot or another Toma Root)

knowledge_chunks.topic: Objective: Explore the Map Before Day 30
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section advises using the time before Day 30 to explore the map, specifically to find one of the two Desert biomes. These biomes contain different types of Cacti, which are important resources.

data.objective: Explore the map and locate one of the two Desert biomes before the Day 30 boss fight.

points_of_interest.name: Dragonfly Desert
points_of_interest.description: Has a sandy turf and contains round Cacti.

points_of_interest.name: Oasis Desert
points_of_interest.description: Has a sandy turf and contains tall Cacti.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Quick Tip: Getting Gold from Spoiling Meat
knowledge_chunks.summary: A quick tip on how to convert spoiling meat or monster meat into gold. This involves feeding it to a caged bird to get eggs, then giving the eggs to the Pig King.

steps: Feed spoiling meat or monster meat to a caged bird.
Give the Eggs to the Pig King.
The Pig King will reward you with Gold Nuggets.
data.benefit: Provides an easy source of gold from an otherwise wasted resource.

knowledge_chunks.summary: To avoid frequent trips into the caves, it is recommended to gather about 20 Light Bulbs and store them in a fridge. This ensures a steady supply of fuel for Lanterns and Miner Hats.

data.action: Gather around 20 Light Bulbs from the caves.
data.storage: Store the Light Bulbs in a Fridge to prevent them from spoiling.
data.benefit: Eliminates the need to enter the caves every time you need to refuel your Lantern or Miner Hat.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Pig Poop Tip: Farming Manure and Ham Bats
knowledge_chunks.summary: This tip explains how to farm Manure and craft Ham Bats easily. By feeding a Pig four Monster Meats, it transforms into a Werepig, which provides the necessary materials.

steps: Craft a Pig House near your base.
Feed the spawned Pig four pieces of Monster Meat to turn it into a Werepig.
Kill the Werepig. It drops 2 Meat and 1 Pig Skin, enough to craft a Ham Bat.
To farm Manure (Poop), drop unwanted non-meat food items (like spoiling Light Bulbs) on the ground while the Pig is a Werepig. It will eat them and produce Manure.

knowledge_chunks.summary: During a Hound attack in winter that includes Ice Hounds, you should prioritize killing the Ice Hounds first. When an Ice Hound dies, it releases a freezing blast that immobilizes other nearby hounds, making them easier to defeat.

data.strategy: Target and kill the Ice Hounds first.
data.mechanic: Upon death, an Ice Hound unleashes an area-of-effect freeze attack.
data.benefit: Instantly freezes other nearby Hounds, making the encounter much easier to manage.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A tip for getting the most out of a Log Suit with low durability. Instead of letting it break, you can use it as fuel for a fire, as it provides a massive fuel value regardless of its durability.

data.tip_name: Efficient Fuel with Low Durability Items
data.action: Throw a low-durability Log Suit into a fire.
data.benefit: You get the full, massive fuel value from the Log Suit without losing much utility, since its durability was already low.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A comprehensive guide on preparing for and defeating the Deerclops boss, which spawns on the night of Day 30. It covers preparation, a strategy for controlling its spawn location, and two different methods for fighting it (tanking and kiting).

items: Fresh Ham Bat and a Sign (for spawn manipulation)

spawn_strategy.name: Sign Baiting
spawn_strategy.location: Find an acute-angled peninsula away from your base.
steps: Before nighttime, go to the peninsula.
Place a Sign away from the tip (vertex) of the peninsula.
Stand at the very tip of the peninsula.
When Deerclops spawns, it will target the closest structure (the Sign), spawn off-screen nearby, and destroy it.
This forces Deerclops to spawn in a predictable location away from your base.

fight_strategies.name: Tanking
fight_strategies.method: Stay near your campfire to avoid being frozen. Wear armor and continuously attack Deerclops. Eat healing food when your health drops and sanity food (Cooked Cactus) to counteract its sanity-draining aura. Standing just within melee range instead of directly under it reduces the sanity drain.

fight_strategies.name: Kiting
fight_strategies.method: Deerclops' attack is a long cone in front of it. To dodge, back away as it starts its attack animation, then move sideways. Having a Walking Cane makes this easier.

data.behavior_if_ignored: Deerclops will target and destroy structures. After destroying 5 structures, it will smile and walk off-screen, despawning permanently if it unloads. If it walks off-screen without smiling, it has not despawned and will be where you left it.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This section outlines how to prepare for Spring, which starts on Day 36. The main threats are rain and lightning, requiring specific gear like the Eyebrella. It also covers the need to repair clothing items with a Sewing Kit.

threats: Rain (causes wetness, cold, freezing, item dropping, sanity loss)

recommended_gear.description: Best option. Provides 100% rain and lightning resistance. Takes the head slot. Crafted with Deerclops Eyeball, 15 Twigs, 4 Bone Shards.
recommended_gear.limit: You can only make as many as you have Deerclops Eyeballs.

recommended_gear.description: Alternative. Provides over 100% rain resistance, but no lightning protection. Takes head and hand slots.
Alternative. Provides 100% rain and lightning resistance. Takes the body slot. Requires 2 Tentacle Spots to craft.

maintenance.usage: Repairs the durability of clothing items (not armor). Recommended to repair items before they reach 0% durability to prevent them from being destroyed.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Both Tomatoes and Potatoes grow well in Spring. This segment suggests a farming layout of a 4x4 combination on each farm tile to yield a good harvest of crops and seeds.

data.strategy: Plant a 4x4 combination of Tomatoes and Potatoes on each farm plot for a good yield of both crops and their respective seeds.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Lureplants spawn in Spring in previously explored areas and create Eyeplants around them that eat items. This guide explains how to kill them and how they can be used defensively.

data.behavior: Spawns a bulb in previously visited locations. After 2 days, it grows Eyeplants in a large radius. Eyeplants will eat any items or small mobs on the ground and transfer them to the main Lureplant bulb, where they are slowly digested.
data.strategy: Kill the central Lureplant bulb to instantly kill all of its Eyeplants. The bulb will drop its loot, including a Leafy Meat and the items it has eaten (if not yet digested).

utility.name: Hound Defense
utility.description: Killing the Lureplant drops its bulb, which can be replanted. Planting it on non-compostable turf (like Cobblestone or Wood Flooring) prevents Eyeplants from spawning on that turf. This allows you to create controlled 'kill zones' where Eyeplants will attack incoming enemies like Hounds.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This is a detailed guide for fighting the optional Spring boss, Moose/Goose, and its offspring, the Moslings. It covers finding the boss, its attack patterns, and the strategy for defeating both the mother and her enraged babies.

data.location: Found at Nesting Grounds, which are setpieces with a pond, a nest of sticks, some trees, and berry bushes.

attacks.name: Normal Attack
attacks.description: A standard melee attack with its horns.

attacks.name: Honk
attacks.description: A loud honk that causes the player to drop their equipped weapon.

phase_1_strategy.pattern: Typically performs three normal attacks, then one honk, and repeats.
phase_1_strategy.strategy: Kite the boss by hitting it 3 times, then dodging. After the third attack, anticipate the honk. When honked, immediately press the pickup button to re-equip your weapon, then dodge its next attack and repeat the pattern.

phase_2_strategy.trigger: Occurs after the Moose/Goose is defeated.
phase_2_strategy.behavior: The baby Moslings become enraged and perform a spinning tornado attack that moves directly toward the player.
phase_2_strategy.strategy: As a Mosling approaches while spinning, simply change your direction of movement to dodge it. After the spin, the Mosling will be stunned and vulnerable to attack. Repeat this for all Moslings. Try to group them up so their spin attacks and stun periods are synchronized.

data.notes: Five Down Feathers are needed for a Summer preparation item. The fight is easier at night as the Moslings will be asleep, allowing you to damage or kill them before engaging the adult.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Boss Fight Guide: Lord of the Fruit Flies
knowledge_chunks.summary: Guide for the Lord of the Fruit Flies, a farming-related boss. It spawns after growing more than 15 farm crops close together after day 35. The fight is relatively easy and yields the useful Friendly Fruit Fly Fruit.

data.spawn_condition: Spawns when the 16th (or more) farm crop fully grows near the player, after Day 35.

attacks.name: Spawn Minions
attacks.description: May spawn small, hostile Fruit Flies that deal minor damage but will un-tend to your plants.

data.strategy: The boss's attack is very fast, making kiting difficult. The recommended strategy is to tank the damage while wearing armor and continuously attacking. Kill the small Fruit Flies after defeating the Lord.

loot.description: An item that spawns a friendly Fruit Fly follower.
loot.utility: The friendly Fruit Fly will automatically tend to your farm crops, keeping them happy without manual interaction from the player.

video_info.title: Ultimate Beginner Survival Guide (ALL Seasons) Don't Starve Together

knowledge_chunks.topic: Lord of the Fruit Flies Boss Fight and Reward
knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk explains how to spawn and defeat the Lord of the Fruit Flies, a boss related to farming. After Day 35, planting over 15 crops closely together will cause it to spawn. The fight is simple, and defeating it yields the Friendly Fruit Fly Fruit, which creates a follower that automatically tends to your crops.

structured_data.spawn_condition: After Day 35, have more than 15 farm crops planted close together. The boss spawns when the 15th (or later) crop fully grows while the player is nearby.
key_mechanics: Attacks are very fast but deal low damage (25).
Spawns smaller, hostile fruit flies that will untend your plants.
structured_data.phase_1_strategy: A simple kite pattern of 3 hits then dodging is effective. Alternatively, you can stand close and continuously attack, tanking the low damage hits. Kill the smaller fruit flies after the main boss is defeated.

notable_loot.description: Spawns a friendly Fruit Fly follower that automatically tends to farm crops, eliminating the need to talk to them manually.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Tip: Farming Guano with Excess Seeds
knowledge_chunks.summary: This tip explains how to productively use excess seeds from farming. By feeding them to a bird captured in a Birdcage, players have a chance to receive Guano.

structured_data.process: Feed excess seeds to a bird in a Birdcage.
structured_data.utility: Guano can be used as a good fuel source or for fertilization.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Farming Tip: How to Grow Giant Crops
knowledge_chunks.summary: A guide on the conditions required to grow giant crops, which yield significantly more vegetables and seeds. This requires near-perfect care, including companion planting, consistent watering, and tending.

structured_data.benefits: Yields 2-3 vegetables and 2-3 seeds per harvested plant.
requirements: Plant crops in a beneficial combination (e.g., 4 Tomatoes and 4 Potatoes together).
Tend to the crops every growth stage.
Water the crops every growth stage.
Have at least 4 of the same type of crop planted close by.
Ensure there are no weeds nearby.
structured_data.notes: The process can be greatly aided by a Friendly Fruit Fly follower and natural rain during Spring. It's not recommended to actively pursue this as a beginner, but it's a great bonus if it happens naturally.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Summer Preparation: Cooling and Fire Prevention
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section covers essential preparations for the Summer season, focusing on the main threats: overheating and wildfires. It details several methods for cooling the player down and protecting the base from fire.

threats.name: Heat/Overheating
threats.description: Player's temperature will rise, leading to health loss if not managed.

threats.name: Wildfires
threats.description: Flammable objects and structures can spontaneously ignite. This does not happen in the first two or last two days of Summer.

preparation_methods.description: Wear the Eyebrella to slow heat gain. Use the Luxury Fan to actively cool down. Fan recipe: 5 Down Feathers, 2 Ropes, 2 Reeds. The fan also extinguishes fires. This method is ineffective for characters with beards.

A trick to make a Thermal Stone ice-cold. Light a flammable item, then use a Watering Can to extinguish it and continuously pour water on the stone. Each pour lowers its temp by 5°C, down to a minimum of -22.5°C.

Keep a Thermal Stone in a Fridge or Ice Chester to cool it to 0°C. Swap it with the one you are carrying to stay cool. Ice Chester is a mobile version, created by putting 9 Blue Gems in Chester's slots during a full moon.
A fire pit that cools the player instead of warming them. Crafted with Nitre and Grass.

A structure that automatically extinguishes fires within its large range. Essential for base protection against wildfires. Can be fueled with logs, charcoal, etc. Note: It will also put out your helpful campfires, so turn it off when they are in use.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Summer Gameplay Tips: Plants, Hounds, and Caves
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section provides various tips for managing gameplay during Summer. It covers which plants wither, the arrival of Fire Hounds, and how the Caves can be used as a safe haven from the heat.

tips.description: On the surface, plants like Grass, Saplings, and Berry Bushes will wilt from the heat unless kept hydrated (e.g., by an Ice Flingomatic or Watering Can). Farm crops are immune to wilting if their soil is moist.
During Summer and subsequent Autumns, Hound attacks will include Fire Hounds. They explode into fire upon death, so kill them away from flammable structures.
The temperature in the Caves is always lower than the surface, making it a safe place to avoid overheating. Plants do not wilt in the caves.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Magic Progression: Crafting the Shadow Manipulator and Dark Sword
knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk details how to advance to the second tier of magic by crafting the Shadow Manipulator. It involves finding gems, creating a Purple Gem, and gathering other materials to unlock powerful magic items like the Dark Sword.

unlocked_items.description: A powerful weapon that costs 5 Nightmare Fuel and 1 Living Log to craft.

structured_data.resource_acquisition: Red and Blue Gems can be found by digging up graves in the Mosaic biome.

knowledge_chunks.summary: A comprehensive guide to the optional Summer boss, Antlion. It covers how to find her in the Oasis, the effects of ignoring her (destructive tremors), how to appease her or initiate the fight, and a detailed strategy for combat.

structured_data.behavior: If ignored, she will cause tremors that create damaging craters under the player, destroying structures. The tremors can be stopped by appeasing or killing her.
structured_data.appeasement: Feed her an ice-cold Thermal Stone to stop tremors for a while.
structured_data.fight_initiation: Attack her directly, or feed her a hot item.
key_mechanics: Summons Sand Castles to trap the player.
Summons Sand Spikes from the ground, which are telegraphed.
Eats rocks to heal if left un-attacked for three of her own attack cycles. Hitting her interrupts the heal.
structured_data.fight_strategy: Dodge the Sand Spikes. Attack her during the openings when her Sand Castles collapse and she is rebuilding them. Use a Dark Sword or Hambat and wear Log Suits for protection. Keep cool with an Endothermic Fire or a cold Thermal Stone.

related_items.function: Negates the vision and movement speed penalties of the sandstorm in the Oasis Desert. The blueprint can be fished from the Oasis lake.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Tip: Using Gunpowder to Cull Beefalo
knowledge_chunks.summary: This tip describes how to manage an overgrown Beefalo herd using Gunpowder. Crafting and detonating gunpowder near sleeping Beefalo is an efficient way to gather meat.

structured_data.goal: Efficiently kill multiple Beefalo for resources.
structured_data.process: Stack 5 Gunpowder next to sleeping Beefalo and light it with a torch. Run away before it explodes.

knowledge_chunks.summary: This covers the Autumn boss, Bearger, who spawns in the second Autumn. The guide explains how to use his destructive attacks to farm wood or fight other mobs like Treeguards, as well as a direct combat strategy.

structured_data.season: Autumn (spawns from the second Autumn onward)
structured_data.utility: His destructive charge attack can be used to chop down entire forests for easy wood collection.
structured_data.strategy_vs_mobs: Can be lured to fight other strong mobs like Treeguards. 2-3 Treeguards can kill Bearger.
structured_data.direct_combat_strategy: Bait his ground slam attack, run in for hits, then dodge his three swipe attacks by moving to his side or behind him. Repeat the pattern. Be careful, as his attacks can make you drop your weapon.

notable_loot.description: Used with gears to craft the Insulated Pack, a backpack that also functions as a fridge to slow food spoilage.
